bug.short_desc: Class to load and parse json files

long_desc.thetext:
As I could see qx.data.store.Json requests json files and converts the received data to qooxdoo objects (marshaller). This is really useful but sometimes developer just wants to load an json file and use the "native" objects.
The code of the store does for about 98% exactly just loading and checking and providing json data, but automatically creates an model. I would love to see both jobs separated from each other.
One class to load json files and handle possible errors and so on, one class to provide and hold qooxdoo class model from json objects.

Don't we have that already:
(In reply to comment #0) > One class to load json files and handle possible errors and so on, XHR
> one class to provide and hold qooxdoo class model from json objects. Marshaler
The JSON store is not that much code and most of it is forwarding the XHR stuff.
